title: why hasn't riot toned down vaynes hp percent true damage?

replies.body: Seems like something we'd prefer not to touch since it's such a core part of the character's identity. If I had to nerf Vayne, it certainly wouldn't be the first place I'd look to hit. I'd prefer to just nerf her early game or reduce the flat damage component of Silver Bolts, but the percent part of it seems pretty core to the identity of the character.

> [{quoted}](name=RiotRepertoir,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gpntPyAO,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2015-08-09T23:49:36.715+0000)

> Seems like something we'd prefer not to touch since it's such a core part of the character's identity. If I had to nerf Vayne, it certainly wouldn't be the first place I'd look to hit. I'd prefer to just nerf her early game or reduce the flat damage component of Silver Bolts, but the percent part of it seems pretty core to the identity of the character.

Out of curiosity, **how would you nerf her early game**? Seems like EVERYTHING in her kit works to the effect of preventing enemies from punishing her early game. She's already pretty weak early game. The problem is she's just not vulnerable early game, especially not with supports like Kench/Thresh around.

At best you can hard deny CS, but she still remains a ticking time bomb, and one kill will close the gap nearly instantly. Considering she's a duelist, even when behind she can out-duel a huge portion of the ADCs out there. **How would this be affected by your change**?

Making her more punishable is an interesting endeavor, I'd really love to hear your thoughts on this. Of course, all hypothetical.

> how would you nerf her early game?

If I had to nerf Vayne's, I'd probably try to first think about why she's too strong in the first place. How did she go from someone seen as having a bad early game to someone seen as pretty average in the early game?

Though these first few suggestions aren't directly nerfs to Vayne and have other implications, I'd probably ask why Caitlyn, Lucian, and other historical lane bullies aren't doing their job to keep her in check. So first, I'd ask why other lane bullies that used to give her trouble aren't being played anymore, and maybe look into that (though that's a multi-champion change).

Also, I'd probably try to determine what exactly is the issue with her early game. Is her early game actually too strong? Or does the state of the game just more or less guarantee that she gets her late game? This second part can be especially relevant, because it makes less sense to have champions that are so disproportionately strong in the late game if games are tending to go five minutes longer than they used to (not sure on the exact numbers on game length at the moment, to be honest).

I'll admit I'm absolutely not an expert on marksman balance, so don't take my suggestions here as gospel. However, there are lots of ways to nerf a champion's early game. Off the top of my head:

* Base AD nerf and increase AD/lvl. Just a couple Base AD makes a huge difference in early game power. I reduced Nidalee's base AD when she was a terror in top lane late last season, and she basically disappeared from the lane.
* Scale her spell damages or cooldowns non-linearly, with the later ranks giving more value than the first. This is unconventional, but there's no reason we really can't do it. For instance, if Tumble's cooldown was only reduced by .5 seconds at early ranks, and 1.5 in the last few (or something like that.
* Probably a bad idea, but maybe Vayne could have 325 or lower MS and have her passive MS increased. I think one of the things about Vayne is that she's supposed to be a statement pick, like "I know this champion isn't good early game, but I'm better than you and can win regardless." Something like this may play that up, though at the expense of snowballiness.

Anyway, just some thoughts off the top of my head.

I'm kind of sick of the idea of champs specifically designed to have a strong late game.  Shouldnt power and carry potential be earned through good play and not champion pick?

Vayne's "late game" starts when she gets {{item:3153}} At this point she can kill anything 1v1 simply because of her silver bolts. Considering most carries cant 1v1 anything without 2 or even 3 full items, I would say Vayne has a very small window of weakness compared to her power spike.

Power and carry potential are partially based on the champion pick because, at its core, this is still a MOBA game. You can't just remove a whole element of the game and then try to keep calling it the same thing. If you remove the ability of a champion pick making a notable impact then you remove one of the core elements of the MOBA genre, one that many people very plainly play for (in addition to the other draws of the game genre). "Should I play Graves for his early dominance or Vayne for her being a late-game powerhouse?" "Should I play Weaver for his early strength, or Spectre for being a late-game God?" etc., is a pretty important type of question in a MOBA game, and if you remove even that then... well, that's pretty bad.

As for WHEN her late-game starts, that may have more to do with balance than the fact that a champion is based around the late-game.

The problem with Your statement is that there is no such thing as "early game" if You prefer to play as an adc. "Early" and "late" game has no literal connection with actual game time and completely different on each champion. Since it's determined by the number of core items they need to fulfill their role properly (except permanent stat stackers) they only have to farm - both levels and golds. Their usefulness in "early game" doesn't matter because it's literally non-existent. And here comes the problem: a competent Vayne can outduel almost everyone even with item disadventage because of her

- targeted abilites
- short-term stealth (R)
- annoying gap closers (passive + Q)
- %HP DMG (W+BOTRK)
- effectiveness with only 1 specific item (BOTRK)
- disengaging mechanism (E)

TL;DR Vayne's teamfight potential after 6 with BOTRK is huge compared to someone like Caitlyn, or Corki. They need more items, better positioning... etc. Vayne's weaknesses are again, non-existent.

Lane bullies are struggling because Riot reduced the AD that they can reasonably build in lane. 

BT gave 100 AD and was a rush, which made it so that champions with high AD ratios like Graves, Caitlyn and Lucian could hit their mid game power spikes pretty easily and crush their lane opponents. 

Now, though, with champions building 20 less AD early and not getting a significant amount of lifesteal, while Vayne is rushing Cutlass to give her more self-peel and sustain, she's simply tanking through the enemy abilities without much care.

Additionally, Riot has nerfed poke supports practically out of existence. Low range marksmen who want to focus on CSing need to be poked out of lane, but Sona is too terrified of Thresh and Leona to be picked, Lulu has been nerfed and basically vanished from bot lane, Soraka lost her manaless poke, and Zyra...I don't know what happened to Zyra but she's basically been non-existent since mid S4. 

There's no one to challenge Vayne. If Leona hops on Vayne, Vayne will just knock her back. Poke supports and ratio carries need to be strong to keep Vayne in check, and ratio carries need access to a good mid-game item that provides sustain. Essence Reaver and BT just aren't good enough to be rushed.

I think the main reason Vayne isn't weak early-game is based in her kit.  Once you get a modicum of skill with her she goes from being a risky pick with a bad early game to one of the safest ADC picks that's hard to shut down.  Think about it:

- She has 550 range, which is about average.  This means most other ADCs can't really bully her without getting shot in return.  She actually outranges most ADC lane bullies, except obviously Caitlyn.
- Tumble makes her very safe.  Its low cooldown and cheap mana cost make it a great tool for not being hit by anything.
- If an enemy gets close she can Condemn them away, keeping her safe from ganks.
- Once she gets her ultimate she gains short-term Stealth, making her even harder to pin down or gank.

All this on a hypercarry duelist's kit ensures that she can stay safe early game then explode into the late game unless a disproportionate amount of attention is dumped into shutting her down.

Early game?

Let's say you are Draven, and you are both level 3.
Draven has 679 health.  4% of that is ~27 hp.  Add the flat damage and Vayne deals 47 true damage on every third attack.

That's less than one autoattack for most ADCs.  It's less than nearly every other level 1 skill.

Why is her tiny amount of true damage so annoying early-game?
